definitions: The application of energy to something.
The process in which an atom or other particle adopts a higher energy state when energy is supplied.
The state of enhanced activity of a cell, organism, or tissue which results from its stimulation.
The application of current to the winding of an electromagnet to produce a magnetic field.
The application of a signal voltage to the control electrode of an electron tube or the base of a transistor.
The action of exciting or the state of being excited; excitement.
